GOD.content: responsibility, aporia btwn choice and heresy (hairesis as choice, election), a type of secrecy that keeps responsibility apart (tient la responsabilité à l’écart) and in secret, the very thing responsibility insists on
GOD.linkedContent: responsibility, aporia btwn choice and heresy (hairesis as choice, election), a type of secrecy that keeps responsibility apart (tient la responsabilité à l’écart) and in secret, the very thing responsibility insists on

GOD.content: covenant remains absolutely singular in its election, if there’s no 3rd party, no hypothetical imperative, no generality of ethical, political, juridical
GOD.linkedContent: covenant remains absolutely singular in its election, if there’s no 3rd party, no hypothetical imperative, no generality of ethical, political, juridical

H.content: host must elect, choose, filter, must have power, no hospitality w/out finitude: Gewalt, force of law
H.linkedContent: host must elect, choose, filter, must have power, no hospitality w/out finitude: Gewalt, force of law

AF.content: along with openness to future, via Yerushalmi, Jew has historicity, obligation of memory, of the archive
AF.linkedContent: along with openness to future, via Yerushalmi, Jew has historicity, obligation of memory, of the archive

AF.content: 2 specificities, exclusivities, responsibilities, in absolute privilege of election
AF.linkedContent: 2 specificities, exclusivities, responsibilities, in absolute privilege of election

AF.content: Derrida trembles when Yerushalmi declares “only in Israel” [is there future, is there past], logic of election, question of proper name, exemplarity > place of all violences
AF.linkedContent: Derrida trembles when Yerushalmi declares “only in Israel” [is there future, is there past], logic of election, question of proper name, exemplarity > place of all violences

AF.content: if it is just to remember to guard and gather archive, it’s just as just to remember the others, tout autre est tout autre [invaginates]
AF.linkedContent: if it is just to remember to guard and gather archive, it’s just as just to remember the others, tout autre est tout autre [invaginates]

FWT.content: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us
FWT.linkedContent: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us

FWT.content: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: I am the only one called to do this or that, irreplaceable in the place of decision, in obligation to respond “I am here,” this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name, if there is any, its chance/condition > also, Derrida is very suspicious of “doctrine” of election, & binding this universal to Judaism
FWT.linkedContent: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: I am the only one called to do this or that, irreplaceable in the place of decision, in obligation to respond “I am here,” this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name, if there is any, its chance/condition > also, Derrida is very suspicious of “doctrine” of election, & binding this universal to Judaism

FWT.content: circumcision: someone marked my destiny before I had a word to say > (true for women too, something preceded your Catholicism, Derrida tells E.R.)
FWT.linkedContent: circumcision: someone marked my destiny before I had a word to say > (true for women too, something preceded your Catholicism, Derrida tells E.R.)

POOF.content: via Aristotle, one must choose & prefer friends (election & selection), it takes time > for Aristotle, those who don’t have friends count friends among things (prágmata), possessions, the malevolent place friends in field of calculable hypothesis > yet, the choice of friends, that their # must be small, reintroduces #, calculation, into multiplicity of incalculable singularities: a certain aristocracy in arithmetic of the choice
POOF.linkedContent: via Aristotle, one must choose & prefer friends (election & selection), it takes time > for Aristotle, those who don’t have friends count friends among things (prágmata), possessions, the malevolent place friends in field of calculable hypothesis > yet, the choice of friends, that their # must be small, reintroduces #, calculation, into multiplicity of incalculable singularities: a certain aristocracy in arithmetic of the choice

POOF.content: does the autarkic (self-sufficient) man need a friend? [Aristotle’s Eudemian Ethics, Plato’s Lysis] > rarity is the virtue of friendship [p. 225n rarity also among Christian monks]
POOF.linkedContent: does the autarkic (self-sufficient) man need a friend? [Aristotle’s Eudemian Ethics, Plato’s Lysis] > rarity is the virtue of friendship [p. 225n rarity also among Christian monks]

POOF.content: scarcity, rareness, is worth more—sometimes to the extreme > scarcity sets the price of true friendship [hyperbole, incommensurable]
POOF.linkedContent: scarcity, rareness, is worth more—sometimes to the extreme > scarcity sets the price of true friendship [hyperbole, incommensurable]

POOF.content: for Kant, friendship is rare, the rarity of keeping a secret, a black swan > [Derrida seems to hint that Kant is getting personal here: Kant murmurs a confession]
POOF.linkedContent: for Kant, friendship is rare, the rarity of keeping a secret, a black swan > [Derrida seems to hint that Kant is getting personal here: Kant murmurs a confession]

ATIA.content: Derrida’s exceptionalism, sentiment of election, always exempted himself, in everything he’s written, erased, traced, from the “they” who name the “animal” > “as if I were the secret elect of what they call animals”
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s exceptionalism, sentiment of election, always exempted himself, in everything he’s written, erased, traced, from the “they” who name the “animal” > “as if I were the secret elect of what they call animals”

WAP.content: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also affects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)
WAP.linkedContent: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also affects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)

DPi.content: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”
DPi.linkedContent: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”

DPi.content: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius
DPi.linkedContent: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius

DPi.content: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation
DPi.linkedContent: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation

PF.content: decision supposes passage through undecidable of a crisis/krinein/krisis (choice of election, selection: legere, lecture/reading)
PF.linkedContent: decision supposes passage through undecidable of a crisis/krinein/krisis (choice of election, selection: legere, lecture/reading)

EJQB.content: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity

EJQB.content: Jabes: “what difference is there btwn choosing and being chosen when we can do nothing but submit to the choice?”
EJQB.linkedContent: Jabes: “what difference is there btwn choosing and being chosen when we can do nothing but submit to the choice?”

HST.content: Abrahamic substitution not a homogenous, identical (cloning) replacement but that of exception, election > implicates (engage) each singularity in responsibility to give, to sacrifice themselves as pledge (comme gage) > still, not a free, voluntary act: there’s grace, a certain passivity
HST.linkedContent: Abrahamic substitution not a homogenous, identical (cloning) replacement but that of exception, election > implicates (engage) each singularity in responsibility to give, to sacrifice themselves as pledge (comme gage) > still, not a free, voluntary act: there’s grace, a certain passivity

AD.content: for Levinas, the hôte is a hostage insofar as he’s a subject obsessed (thus besieged), persecuted, put into question in the place where he takes place—in election
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, the hôte is a hostage insofar as he’s a subject obsessed (thus besieged), persecuted, put into question in the place where he takes place—in election

AD.content: “Torah before Sinai,” law before event, recognition of Torah by those for whom event of Sinai means nothing? a recognition by some 3rd, that would replace unique w/ unique? > a universal message in election of Israel (humanitarian hospitality uprooted from singularity of event, which becomes empirical, allegorical, “political” in restricted sense) [see p. 72]
AD.linkedContent: “Torah before Sinai,” law before event, recognition of Torah by those for whom event of Sinai means nothing? a recognition by some 3rd, that would replace unique w/ unique? > a universal message in election of Israel (humanitarian hospitality uprooted from singularity of event, which becomes empirical, allegorical, “political” in restricted sense) [see p. 72]

AD.content: absolute past: “word of God” —will have taken place before taking place, older than Sinai—truth of messianic exceeds national identity; p. 142n absolute “lateness”: older yes
AD.linkedContent: absolute past: “word of God” —will have taken place before taking place, older than Sinai—truth of messianic exceeds national identity; p. 142n absolute “lateness”: older yes

AD.content: election not restricted to particular place/identity, inseparable from what seems to contest it: substitution
AD.linkedContent: election not restricted to particular place/identity, inseparable from what seems to contest it: substitution

AD.content: iterability: replaceability of unique in experience of unicity [see p. 72]
AD.linkedContent: iterability: replaceability of unique in experience of unicity [see p. 72]

AD.content: for Levinas, allotted (allouée) home is not natural, it’s elected
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, allotted (allouée) home is not natural, it’s elected

AD.content: God, one “who loves the stranger” excessively so, excess like the non-reciprocity decided in death, the trait or stroke, the hyphen (trait d’union) of adieu: beyond being, where he might not pardon me, or elect me
AD.linkedContent: God, one “who loves the stranger” excessively so, excess like the non-reciprocity decided in death, the trait or stroke, the hyphen (trait d’union) of adieu: beyond being, where he might not pardon me, or elect me

AD.content: Levinas trying to delimit a faith in election safe from (à l’abri de) all “nationalist” temptation
AD.linkedContent: Levinas trying to delimit a faith in election safe from (à l’abri de) all “nationalist” temptation

BSi.content: not reading: neglect (neglego, neglegere), not gathering (legere), not electing (élire) [one doesn’t have to neglect the book to neglect to read]
BSi.linkedContent: not reading: neglect (neglego, neglegere), not gathering (legere), not electing (élire) [one doesn’t have to neglect the book to neglect to read]

BSi.content: deciding actors [political leaders] consecrated by election of their erection to status of marionette in the puppet show [in English]
BSi.linkedContent: deciding actors [political leaders] consecrated by election of their erection to status of marionette in the puppet show [in English]

CIR.content: sign of circumcision will ensure Jewish nation an eternal existence > this sign of circumcision & election is foreign to understanding and true virtue
CIR.linkedContent: sign of circumcision will ensure Jewish nation an eternal existence > this sign of circumcision & election is foreign to understanding and true virtue

CIR.content: chosen race (genus electum) waiting for the envelope to open, seals to break like skins, so that finally, ceasing to eye your pocket, they enter terrible/sweet truth you bear
CIR.linkedContent: chosen race (genus electum) waiting for the envelope to open, seals to break like skins, so that finally, ceasing to eye your pocket, they enter terrible/sweet truth you bear
